intro: Strobilanthes panichanga, commonly known as the Panichanga flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species, making conservation efforts essential for its survival.
